meanings.definition: The act of coming into contact or touching something.
meanings.sent1: The gentle appulses of the kitten's paws on the window were comforting.
meanings.sent2: The appulses of the two cars in the parking lot caused a small dent.
meanings.sent3: The appulses of the two magnets created a funny dance on the table.
meanings.sent4: The appulses of the waves against the shore sounded like a soothing lullaby.
meanings.sent5: The appulses of the raindrops on the roof made a rhythmic pattern.

meanings.definition: The point at which two celestial bodies are closest in their orbits.
meanings.sent1: Astronomers study the appulses of planets to understand their movements.
meanings.sent2: The appulses of the moon and Earth create beautiful lunar eclipses.
meanings.sent3: During the appulses of the stars, the night sky seems even more magical.
meanings.sent4: The appulses of the comets in the sky are a rare sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The appulses of the asteroids can sometimes be seen with a telescope.
